definition: just (in time)/just right/just enough/to happen to/to chance to/by chance/it just so happens that
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Well, my surface sits exactly above this region U in the xy plane.
sentences.chinese: 这个曲面正好在xy平面上，区域U的上方。

sentences.english: When it occurs in the back near the spinal cord or the nerve roots, it can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 如果正好发生在脊椎或神经附近的话会非常痛苦。

sentences.english: In fact, we heard that kid is right here in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，我们听说那个孩子就正好在森林里。

sentences.english: A hot beanbag may be just the cure you need.
sentences.chinese: 一个热的装着豆类的布袋正好能满足你的需要。

sentences.english: Just something to do, and continue to look at it the second quarter.
sentences.chinese: 正好有事做了，继续看二季吧。

sentences.english: The message came unusually on two tapes, just before we came to Kauai.
sentences.chinese: 信息要录在两盒磁带上，正好在我们回到考艾岛之前。

sentences.english: However, the meaning of the test is the converse of the meaning for assertions.
sentences.chinese: 但是，测试的意义与断言的意义正好相反。

sentences.english: Currently it is the high season to harvest narcissus bulbs.
sentences.chinese: 那现在正好是水仙收获的季节。

sentences.english: I counted the money, we have $943 on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 我数过钱了，我们正好有943美元。

sentences.english: Large-span arch shell concrete-steel structure just meet the requirement.
sentences.chinese: 而大跨径混凝土拱壳结构正好满足了人们的这一要求。

sentences.english: I happened to see a Shanghai Dazhong service station over here.
sentences.chinese: 我看这边正好有上海大众的维修站。

sentences.english: Spring is just wonderful world, Jalan poem several times before the wedding day.
sentences.chinese: 妙是人间春正好，佳期几度惹诗才。

sentences.english: This as it happens can cooperate network of countrywide sales promotion.
sentences.chinese: 这正好可以配合奥维思的全国促销网络。

sentences.english: In that market the asymmetry in risk/reward works in the opposite way to stocks.
sentences.chinese: 在这个市场上，风险回报的不对称性正好与股市相反。

sentences.english: Just, I recently quit a diet of small disciple.
sentences.chinese: 正好，最近我徒儿小戒正在减肥。

definition: just/exactly/to happen to be
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
fortunately/unexpectedly/by coincidence
by chance/by coincidence/to happen to
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it
original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
time/length of time/moment/period
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
at this time/at this moment
fortuitously/luckily/as chance has it
that day/the other day
to run into/to come upon/to meet
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
just recently/just a moment ago
